title: PUNT OF THE WEEK: Specialist mortgage lender Onesavings
text:
What is it?

Onesavings is a specialist lender, which primarily focuses on parts of the mortgage market which are less well-served by traditional banks.

What’s the latest?

It was given the green light to complete its acquisition of Charter Court this week, in a deal which it thinks will help it cut costs and diversify its specialist mortgage loan book.

Who backs it?

Onesavings’ shareholder register reads like a list of big-name investment firms, from Aberdeen Standard to Janus Henderson to Legal & General.

Charter Court investors, who will take 45 per cent of the business, include many of the same names along with activist Elliott.

Why should you invest?

Goodbody analyst John Cronin says it has a strong capital position, commitment to pay dividends, a strong loan book, good management and a leading position in the UK specialist mortgage market.

Why shouldn’t you?

The banking sector is a little out-of-favour at the moment, Cronin says. Any firms focused on the UK market, such as Onesavings, could be susceptible to a Brexit downturn.
